remarks.p: Used to select a control for exclusion by the control's identifier. Specific control statements can be excluded by their statement identifier.

define-assembly.description: Used to select a control for inclusion/exclusion based on one or more control identifiers. A set of statement identifiers can be used to target the inclusion/exclusion to only specific control statements providing more granularity over the specific statements that are within the asessment scope.

define-field.name: statement-id
define-field.description: Used to constrain the selection to only specificly identified statements.

remarks.p: The include-all, specifies all control identified in the baseline are included in the scope if this assessment, as specified by the include-profile statement within the linked SSP.
Any control specified within exclude-controls must first be within a range of explicitly included controls, via include-controls or include-all.

define-assembly.name: control-objective-selection
define-assembly.description: Identifies the control objectives of the assessment. In the assessment plan, these are the planned objectives. In the assessment results, these are the assessed objectives, and reflects any changes from the plan.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this collection of control objectives.

define-assembly.name: include-all
define-assembly.description: A key word to indicate all.

remarks.p: Used to select a control objective for inclusion by the control objective's identifier.
Used to select a control objective for exclusion by the control objective's identifier.
The include-all field, specifies all control objectives for any in-scope control. In-scope controls are defined in the control-selection.
Any control objective specified within exclude-controls must first be within a range of explicitly included control objectives, via include-objectives or include-all.

In the context of an assessment plan, this construct is used to identify the controls and control objectives that are to be assessed. In the context of an assessment result, this construct is used to identify the actual controls and objectives that were assessed, reflecting any changes from the plan.
When resolving the selection of controls and control objectives, the following processing will occur:
1. Controls will be resolved by creating a set of controls based on the control-selections by first handling the includes, and then removing any excluded controls.

2. The set of control objectives will be resolved from the set of controls that was generated in the previous step. The set of control objectives is based on the control-objective-selection by first handling the includes, and then removing any excluded control objectives.

define-assembly.name: select-objective-by-id
define-assembly.description: Used to select a control objective for inclusion/exclusion based on the control objective's identifier.

define-flag.name: objective-id
define-flag.description: Points to an assessment objective.

define-assembly.name: assessment-subject-placeholder
define-assembly.description: Used when the assessment subjects will be determined as part of one or more other assessment activities. These assessment subjects will be recorded in the assessment results in the assessment log.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.formal-name: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies a set of assessment subjects that will be identified by a task or an activity that is part of a task.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of intent of this assessment subject placeholder.

define-assembly.name: source
define-assembly.description: Assessment subjects will be identified while conducting the referenced activity-instance.

define-flag.name: task-uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies an assessment activity to be performed as part of the event. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. A UUID should be consistantly used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

define-assembly.name: assessment-subject
define-assembly.description: Identifies system elements being assessed, such as components, inventory items, and locations. In the assessment plan, this identifies a planned assessment subject. In the assessment results this is an actual assessment subject, and reflects any changes from the plan. exactly what will be the focus of this assessment. Any subjects not identified in this way are out-of-scope.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: Indicates the type of assessment subject, such as a component, inventory, item, location, or party represented by this selection statement.

allowed-values.enum: The referenced assessment subject is a component defined in the SSP, or in the local-definitions of an Assessment Plan or Assessment Results.
The referenced assessment subject is a inventory item defined in the SSP, or in the local-definitions of an Assessment Plan or Assessment Results.
The referenced assessment subject is a location defined in the metadata of the SSP, Assessment Plan, or Assessment Results.
The referenced assessment subject is a person or team to interview, who is defined as a party in the metadata of the SSP, Assessment Plan, or Assessment Results.
The referenced assessment subject is a user defined in the SSP, or in the local-definitions of an Assessment Plan or Assessment Results.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of the collection of subjects being included in this assessment.

define-assembly.name: include-all
define-assembly.description: A key word to indicate all.

remarks.p: Processing of an include/excluse pair starts with processing the include, then removing matching entries in the exlcude.

define-assembly.name: select-subject-by-id
define-assembly.description: Identifies a set of assessment subjects to include/exclude by UUID.

define-flag.name: uuid-ref
define-flag.description: A pointer to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

define-assembly.name: assessment-assets
define-assembly.description: Identifies the assets used to perform this assessment, such as the assessment team, scanning tools, and assumptions.

remarks.p: Used to add any components for tools used during the assessment. These are represented here to avoid mixing with system compoenents.

The technology tools used by the assessor to perform the assessment, such as vulnerability scanners. In the assessment plan these are the intended tools. In the assessment results, these are the actual tools used, including any differences from the assessment plan.

define-assembly.name: assessment-platform
define-assembly.description: Used to represent the toolset used to perform aspects of the assessment.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this assessment Platform.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title or name for the assessment platform.

define-assembly.name: uses-component
define-assembly.description: The set of components that are used by the assessment platform.

define-flag.name: component-uuid
define-flag.description: A reference to a component that is implemented as part of an inventory item.

remarks.p: This construct is used to either: 1) associate a party or parties to a role defined on the component using the responsible-role construct, or 2) to define a party or parties that are responsible for a role defined within the context of the containing inventory-item.

define-assembly.name: finding-target
define-assembly.description: Captures an assessor's conclusions regarding the degree to which an objective is satisfied.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: Identifies the type of the target.

allowed-values.enum: A reference to a control statement identifier within a control.
A reference to a control objective identifier within a control.

remarks.p: The target will always be a reference to: 1) a control statement, or 2) a control objective. In the former case, there is always a single top-level statement within a control. Thus, if the entire control is targeted, this statement identifier can be used.

define-flag.name: id-ref
define-flag.description: Identifies the specific target qualified by the type.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this objective status.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of the assessor's conclusions regarding the degree to which an objective is satisfied.

define-field.name: status
define-field.description: A brief indication as to whether the objective is satisfied or not within a given system.

allowed-values.enum: The objective has been completely satisfied.
The objective has not been completely satisfied, but may be partially satisfied.

define-assembly.name: observation
define-assembly.description: Describes an individual observation.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this observation. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistantly used for a given observation across revisions.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this observation.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this assessment observation.

define-field.name: method
define-field.description: Identifies how the observation was made.

allowed-values.enum: An inspection was performed.
An interview was performed.
A manual or automated test was performed.
This is only for use when converting historic content to OSCAL, where the conversion process cannot initially identify the appopriate method(s).

define-field.name: type
define-field.description: Identifies the nature of the observation. More than one may be used to further qualify and enable filtering.

allowed-values.enum: A difference between the SSP implementation statement, and actual implementation.
An observation about the status of a the associated control objective.
A mitigating factor was identified.
An assessment finding. Used for observations made by tools, penetration testing, and other means.
An observation from a past assessment, which was converted to OSCAL at a later date.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool that gathered the evidence resulting in the observation identification.

define-assembly.name: subject-reference

remarks.p: Identifies who was interviewed, or what was tested or inspected.

define-assembly.description: A pointer to a resource based on its universally unique identifier (UUID). Use type to indicate whether the identified resource is a component, inventory item, location, user, or something else.

define-flag.name: uuid-ref
define-flag.description: A pointer to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the uuid-ref.

allowed-values.enum: Component
Inventory Item
Location
Interview Party
User
Resource or Artifact

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title or name for the referenced subject.

remarks.p: The subject reference UUID could point to an item defined in the SSP, AP, or AR.
Tools should check look for the ID in every file imported directly or indirectly.

define-assembly.name: relevant-evidence
define-assembly.description: Links this observation to relevant evidence.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: >A resolvable URL reference to relevant evidence.

remarks.p: The value of the href can be an internet resource, or a local reference using a fragment e.g. #fragment that points to a back-matter resource in the same document.

If a local reference using a fragment is used, this will be indicated by a fragment "#" followed by an identifier which references an identified resource in the document's back-matter or another object that is within the scope of the containing OSCAL document.

If an internet resource is used, the href value will be an absolute or relative URI pointing to the location of the referenced resource. A relative URI will be resolved relative to the location of the document containing the link.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this evidence.

define-field.name: collected
define-field.description: Date/time stamp identifying when the finding information was collected.

define-field.name: expires
define-field.description: Date/time identifying when the finding information is out-of-date and no longer valid. Typically used with continuous assessment scenarios.

define-assembly.name: origin
define-assembly.description: Identifies the source of the finding, such as a tool, interviewed person, or activity.

define-assembly.name: origin-actor
define-assembly.description: The actor that produces an observation, a finding, or a risk. One or more actor type can be used to specify a person that is using a tool.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: The kind of actor.

allowed-values.enum: A reference to a tool component defined with the assessment assets.
A reference to an assessment-platform defined with the assessment assets.
A reference to a party defined within the document metadata.

define-flag.name: uuid-ref
define-flag.description: A pointer to the tool or person based on the associated type.

define-flag.name: role-id
define-flag.description: For a party, this can optionally be used to specify the role the actor was performing.

define-assembly.name: related-task
define-assembly.description: Identifies an individual task for which the containing object is a consequence of.

define-flag.name: task-uuid
define-flag.description: References a unique task by UUID.

remarks.p: Identifies the person or organization responsible for performing a specific role defined by the activity.
The assessment subjects that the task was performed against.

define-assembly.name: identified-subject
define-assembly.description: Used to detail assessment subjects that were identfied by this task.

define-flag.name: subject-placeholder-uuid
define-flag.formal-name: Assessment Subject Placeholder Universally Unique Identifier Reference
define-flag.description: References a unique assessment subject placeholder defined by this task.

remarks.p: The assessment subjects that the task identified, which will be used by another task through a subject-placeholder reference. Such a task will "consume" these subjects.

define-field.name: threat-id
define-field.description: A pointer, by ID, to an externally-defined threat.

define-flag.name: system
define-flag.description: Specifies the source of the threat information.

allowed-values.enum: The value conforms to FedRAMP definitions.

define-flag.name: href
define-flag.description: An optional location for the threat data, from which this ID originates.

define-assembly.name: risk
define-assembly.description: An identified risk.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this risk. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistantly used for a given risk across revisions.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this risk.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable summary of what was identified regarding the risk.

define-field.name: statement
define-field.description: An summary of impact for how the risk affects the system.

define-field.name: status
define-field.description: Describes the status of the associated risk.

allowed-values.enum: The risk has been identified.
The identified risk is being investigated. (Open risk)
Remediation activities are underway, but are not yet complete. (Open risk)
A risk deviation, such as false positive, risk reduction, or operational requirement has been submitted for approval. (Open risk)
A risk deviation, such as false positive, risk reduction, or operational requirement has been approved. (Open risk)
The risk has been resolved.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool that identified this risk.

define-assembly.name: mitigating-factor
define-assembly.description: Describes an existing mitigating factor that may affect the overall determination of the risk, with an optional link to an implementation statement in the SSP.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this mitigating factor. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistantly used for a given mitigating factor across revisions.

define-flag.name: implementation-uuid
define-flag.description: Points to an implementation statement in the SSP.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this mitigating factor.

define-assembly.name: subject-reference

remarks.p: Links identifiable elements of the system to this mitigating factor, such as an inventory-item or component.

define-assembly.description: A pointer to a resource based on its universally unique identifier (UUID). Use type to indicate whether the identified resource is a component, inventory item, location, user, or something else.

define-flag.name: uuid-ref
define-flag.description: A pointer to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the uuid-ref.

allowed-values.enum: Component
Inventory Item
Location
Interview Party
User
Resource or Artifact

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title or name for the referenced subject.

remarks.p: The subject reference UUID could point to an item defined in the SSP, AP, or AR.
Tools should check look for the ID in every file imported directly or indirectly.

define-field.name: deadline
define-field.description: The date/time by which the risk must be resolved.

define-assembly.name: response
define-assembly.description: Describes either recommended or an actual plan for addressing the risk.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this remediation. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistantly used for a given remediation across revisions.

define-flag.name: lifecycle
define-flag.description: Identifies whether this is a recommendation, such as from an assessor or tool, or an actual plan accepted by the system owner.

allowed-values.enum: Recommended Remediation
The actions intended to resolve the risk.
This remediation activities were performed to address the risk.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this response activity.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this response plan.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool that generated this recommended or planned response.

define-assembly.name: required-asset
define-assembly.description: Identifies an asset required to achieve remediation.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this required asset. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. Once assigned, a UUID should be consistantly used for a given required asset across revisions.

define-assembly.name: subject-reference

remarks.p: Identifies an asset associated with this requirement, such as a party, system component, or inventory-item.

define-assembly.description: A pointer to a resource based on its universally unique identifier (UUID). Use type to indicate whether the identified resource is a component, inventory item, location, user, or something else.

define-flag.name: uuid-ref
define-flag.description: A pointer to a component, inventory-item, location, party, user, or resource using it's UUID.

define-flag.name: type
define-flag.description: Used to indicate the type of object pointed to by the uuid-ref.

allowed-values.enum: Component
Inventory Item
Location
Interview Party
User
Resource or Artifact

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title or name for the referenced subject.

remarks.p: The subject reference UUID could point to an item defined in the SSP, AP, or AR.
Tools should check look for the ID in every file imported directly or indirectly.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this required asset.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this required asset.

allowed-values.enum: The UUID of the person or organization who made the recommendation
The UUID of the tool that made the recommendation
The risk will be eliminated.
The risk will be reduced.
The risk will be transferred to another organization or entity.
The risk will continue to exist without further efforts to address it. (Sometimes referred to as "Operationally required")
The risk will be partially transferred to another organization or entity.
Plans will be made to address the risk impact if the risk occurs. (This is a form of mitigaton.)
No response, such as when the identified risk is found to be a false positive.

define-assembly.name: risk-log
define-assembly.description: A log of all risk-related actions taken.

define-assembly.name: entry
define-assembly.description: Identifies the result of an action and/or task that occured as part of executing an assessment plan or an assessment event that occured in producing the assessment results.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.formal-name: Risk Log Entry Universally Unique Identifier
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies an assessment event. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. A UUID should be consistantly used for this schedule across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title for this event.

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of this event.

define-field.name: start
define-field.description: Identifies the start date and time of an event.

define-field.name: end
define-field.description: Identifies the end date and time of an event. If the event is a point in time, the start and end will be the same date and time.

remarks.p: Identifies a change in risk status made by the action described in this risk log entry. This allows the risk's status history to be captured as a sequence of risk log entries.

define-assembly.name: related-response
define-assembly.description: Identifies an individual risk response that this log entry is for.

define-flag.name: response-uuid
define-flag.description: References a unique risk response by UUID.

remarks.p: This is used to identify the response action that this log entry relates to.

allowed-values.enum: The type of remediation tracking entry. Can be multi-valued.
Contacted vendor to determine the status of a pending fix to a known vulnerability.
Information related to the current state of response to this risk.
A significant step in the response plan has been achieved.
An activity was completed that reduces the likelihood or impact of this risk.
An activitiy was completed that eliminates the likelihood or impact of this risk.
The risk is no longer applicable to the system.
A deviation request was made to the authorizing official.
A previously submitted deviation request has been modified.
The authorizing official approved the deviation.
The authorizing official rejected the deviation.

define-assembly.name: related-observation
define-assembly.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

define-flag.name: observation-uuid
define-flag.description: References an observation defined in the list of observations.

allowed-values.enum: The risk has been confirmed to be a false positive.
The risk has been accepted. No further action will be taken.
The risk has been adjusted.
A numeric value indicating the sequence in which risks should be addressed. (Lower numbers are higher priority)

define-assembly.name: logged-by
define-assembly.description: Used to indicate who created a log entry in what role.

define-flag.name: party-uuid
define-flag.description: A pointer to the party who is making the log entry.

define-flag.name: role-id
define-flag.description: A point to the role-id of the role in which the party is making the log entry.

define-field.name: risk-status
define-field.description: Describes the status of the associated risk.

allowed-values.enum: The risk has been identified.
The identified risk is being investigated. (Open risk)
Remediation activities are underway, but are not yet complete. (Open risk)
A risk deviation, such as false positive, risk reduction, or operational requirement has been submitted for approval. (Open risk)
A risk deviation, such as false positive, risk reduction, or operational requirement has been approved. (Open risk)
The risk has been resolved.

define-assembly.name: characterization
define-assembly.description: A collection of descriptive data about the containing object from a specific origin.

remarks.p: metadata about the specific actor that generated this descriptive data.

define-assembly.name: facet
define-assembly.description: An individual characteristic that is part of a larger set produced by the same actor.

define-flag.name: name
define-flag.description: The name of the risk metric within the specified system.

define-flag.name: system
define-flag.description: Specifies the naming system under which this risk metric is organized, which allows for the same names to be used in different systems controlled by different parties. This avoids the potential of a name clash.

allowed-values.enum: The facet is from an unknown taxonomy. The meaning of the name is tool or organization specific.

define-flag.name: value
define-flag.description: Indicates the value of the facet.

allowed-values.enum: Indicates if the facet is 'initial' as first identified, or 'adjusted' indicating that the value has be changed after some adjustments have been made (e.g., to identify residual risk).
As first identified.
Indicates that residual risk remains after some adjustments have been made.

define-assembly.name: assessment-part
define-assembly.description: A partition of an assessment plan or results or a child of another part.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: A unique identifier for a specific part instance. This identifier's uniqueness is document scoped and is intended to be consistent for the same part across minor revisions of the document.

define-flag.name: name
define-flag.description: A textual label that uniquely identifies the part's semantic type.

allowed-values.enum: An assessment asset.
An assessment method.
Describes a set of control objectives.

define-flag.name: ns
define-flag.description: A namespace qualifying the part's name. This allows different organizations to associate distinct semantics with the same name.

remarks.p: Provides a means to segment the value space for the name, so that different organizations and individuals can assert control over the allowed names and associated text used in a part. This allows the semantics associated with a given name to be defined on an organization-by-organization basis.
An organization MUST use a URI that they have control over. e.g., a domain registered to the organization in a URI, a registered uniform resource names (URN) namespace.
When a ns is not provided, its value should be assumed to be http://csrc.nist.gov/ns/oscal and the name should be a name defined by the associated OSCAL model.

define-flag.name: class
define-flag.description: A textual label that provides a sub-type or characterization of the part's name. This can be used to further distinguish or discriminate between the semantics of multiple parts of the same control with the same name and ns.

remarks.p: A class can be used in validation rules to express extra constraints over named items of a specific class value.
A class can also be used in an OSCAL profile as a means to target an alteration to control content.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: A name given to the part, which may be used by a tool for display and navigation.

define-field.name: prose
define-field.description: Permits multiple paragraphs, lists, tables etc.

allowed-values.enum: The assessment method to use. This typically appears on parts with the name "assessment".
The process of holding discussions with individuals or groups of individuals within an organization to once again, facilitate assessor understanding, achieve clarification, or obtain evidence.
The process of reviewing, inspecting, observing, studying, or analyzing one or more assessment objects (i.e., specifications, mechanisms, or activities).
The process of exercising one or more assessment objects (i.e., activities or mechanisms) under specified conditions to compare actual with expected behavior.

remarks.p: A part provides for logical partitioning of prose, and can be thought of as a grouping structure (e.g., section). A part can have child parts allowing for arbitrary nesting of prose content (e.g., statement hierarchy). A part can contain prop objects that allow for enriching prose text with structured name/value information.

A part can be assigned an optional id, which allows for internal and external references to the textual concept contained within a part. A id provides a means for an OSCAL profile, or a higher layer OSCAL model to reference a specific part within a catalog. For example, an id can be used to reference or to make modifications to a control statement in a profile.

Use of part and prop provides for a wide degree of extensibility within the OSCAL catalog model. The optional ns provides a means to qualify a part's name, allowing for organization-specific vocabularies to be defined with clear semantics. Any organization that extends OSCAL in this way should consistently assign a ns value that represents the organization, making a given namespace qualified name unique to that organization. This allows the combination of ns and name to always be unique and unambiguous, even when mixed with extensions from other organizations. Each organization is responsible for governance of their own extensions, and is strongly encouraged to publish their extensions as standards to their user community. If no ns is provided, the name is expected to be in the "OSCAL" namespace.

To ensure a ns is unique to an organization and naming conflicts are avoided, a URI containing a DNS or other globally defined organization name should be used. For example, if FedRAMP and DoD both extend OSCAL, FedRAMP will use the ns "https://fedramp.gov", while DoD will use the ns "https://defense.gov" for any organization specific name.

Tools that process OSCAL content are not required to interpret unrecognized OSCAL extensions; however, OSCAL-compliant tools should not modify or remove unrecognized extensions, unless there is a compelling reason to do so, such as data sensitivity.

define-assembly.name: plan-of-action-and-milestones
define-assembly.description: A plan of action and milestones which identifies initial and residual risks, deviations, and disposition, such as those required by FedRAMP.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies this POA&M. This UUID must be changed each time the content of the POA&M changes.

remarks.p: Used by the POA&M to import information about the system.
Either an OSCAL-based SSP must be imported, or a unique system-id must be specified. Both may be present.

define-assembly.name: local-definitions
define-assembly.description: Allows components, and inventory-items to be defined within the POA&M for circumstances where no OSCAL-based SSP exists, or is not delivered with the POA&M.

remarks.p: Used to add any components, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)
Used to add any inventory-items, not defined via the System Security Plan (AR->AP->SSP)

define-assembly.name: poam-item
define-assembly.description: Describes an individual POA&M item.

define-flag.name: uuid
define-flag.description: Uniquely identifies the POA&M entry. This UUID may be referenced elsewhere in an OSCAL document when refering to this information. A UUID should be consistantly used for a given POA&M item across revisions of the document.

define-field.name: title
define-field.description: The title or name for this POA&M item .

define-field.name: description
define-field.description: A human-readable description of POA&M item.

define-assembly.name: origin
define-assembly.description: Identifies the source of the finding, such as a tool or person.

remarks.p: Used to identify the individual and/or tool generated this poam-item.

define-assembly.name: related-observation
define-assembly.description: Relates the poam-item to a set of referenced observations that were used to determine the finding.

define-flag.name: observation-uuid
define-flag.description: References an observation defined in the list of observations.

define-assembly.name: associated-risk
define-assembly.description: Relates the finding to a set of referenced risks that were used to determine the finding.

define-flag.name: risk-uuid
define-flag.description: References an risk defined in the list of risks.
